channel.title: [317 Delta] Donor Help! [317 delta] Will Rep!
channel.description:
Hey guys. I'm attempting to make a donor zone, for DeltaScape. I am trying to add this code, and my compiler wont take it. lol. Can anyone tell me whats wrong with it? or fix it? and i know i have donor in my source, because theres a list, and a rank.
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("donorzone")&& (donator == 1){

item.title: [317 Delta] Donor Help! [317 delta] Will Rep!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“dwarvenknight, post:2, topic:375868”]Use this command:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("donatorzone") && donator == 1) { triggerTele(XXXX, YYYY, HEIGHT); sM("Welcome to the Donator's Zone."); }

And now make sure you have these in client.java. You should know where they go.

} else if (token.equals("character-donator")) { donator = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.write("character-donator = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(donator), 0, Integer.toString( donator).length());

And i player.java make sure you have declared this:

public int donator;

Thank you Very Much. Rep++ For you sir.

Read full topic
item.source: [317 Delta] Donor Help! [317 delta] Will Rep!

item.title: [317 Delta] Donor Help! [317 delta] Will Rep!
item.dc:creator: @dwarvenknight dwarvenknight
item.description:
@dwarvenknight wrote:

Use this command:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("donatorzone") && donator == 1) { triggerTele(XXXX, YYYY, HEIGHT); sM("Welcome to the Donator's Zone."); }

And now make sure you have these in client.java. You should know where they go.

} else if (token.equals("character-donator")) { donator = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.write("character-donator = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(donator), 0, Integer.toString( donator).length());

And i player.java make sure you have declared this:

public int donator;

Read full topic
